dc_title_s: California Department of Fish and Game Lands: Russian River Basin, 2000
dc_description_s:
This polygon shapefile represents the portion of the lands administered and/or owned by DFG layer within the Russian River basin. These data were derived from a 2000 California Department of Fish and Game (DFG) layer for the entire state of California. Polygon features from the original source data were selected based on their spatial location within the extent of the Russian River basin. This layer can be used for watershed analysis and planning in the Russian River region of California. Circuit Rider Productions and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (2002). California Department of Fish and Game Lands: Russian River Basin, 2000. Circuit Rider Productions. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/kc534gq4006 The DFGLANDS coverage is a digitized geographical inventory of
    selected lands administered and/or owned by the California Department
    of Fish and Game (DFG). Properties such as ecological reserves,
    wildlife areas, undesignated lands containing biological resource
    values, public and fishing access lands, and DFG fish hatcheries are
    among those lands included in this inventory. Types of properties
    owned or administered by DFG which may not be included in this coverage
    are parcels less than 1 acre in size, such as DFG fishing piers, fish
    spawning grounds, fish barriers, and other minor parcels pending mapping
    and attribute assignment. All DFG properties (mapped herein or not)
    are assigned a unique Real Property Number (PROP_NBR). A given property
    may consist of one or more parcels, each identified by a unique Parcel
    History Number (HIST_NBR). These two identifiers are assigned by the
    State of California Department of General Services (DGS).
 
    Physical boundaries of individual parcels are determined by the
    descriptions contained in legal documents and assessor parcel maps
    relating to that parcel. Parcel boundaries are drawn onto U.S.
    Geological Survey 7.5'-series topographic maps, then digitized and
    attributed before addition to the dfglands coverage. " This layer is presented in the WGS84 coordinate system for web display purposes. Downloadable data are provided in native coordinate system or projection.
